rules: Rule1: Either the manuscript is authentic or the manuscript is a genuine artifact
Rule2: If the manuscript was donated by the royal family, then should the manuscript not be a genuine artifact, the manuscript has known provenance
Rule3: Either the manuscript contains historical errors or the manuscript is a genuine artifact
Rule4: Provided that the manuscript shows aging patterns, then the manuscript does not contain historical errors
Rule5: Under the condition that the manuscript has consistent binding, then the manuscript shows aging patterns
Rule6: When the manuscript has original stitching, then the manuscript shows aging patterns
Rule7: If the manuscript underwent restoration, then the manuscript has modern additions
Rule8: If the manuscript underwent restoration, then the manuscript has replaced pages
Rule9: If the manuscript underwent restoration, then the manuscript does not have modern additions
Rule10: Provided that the manuscript passes UV light test, then the manuscript is a genuine artifact
Rule11: When the manuscript passes infrared analysis, then the manuscript is a genuine artifact
Rule12: If the manuscript is a forgery, then the manuscript is not authentic
Rule13: Either the manuscript is a forgery or the manuscript shows modern pigments
Rule14: Under the condition that the manuscript shows chemical anomalies, then the manuscript contains modern materials
Rule15: Provided that the manuscript has water damage, then should the manuscript show chemical anomalies, the manuscript does not contain modern materials
Rule16: When the manuscript has fungal growth, then if the manuscript shows chemical anomalies, the manuscript does not contain modern materials
Rule17: If the manuscript was stored in damp conditions, then the manuscript has water damage
Rule18: Either the manuscript was stored in damp conditions or the manuscript was stored in humid environment
Rule19: Provided that the manuscript shows oxidation patterns, then the manuscript shows aging patterns
Rule20: If the manuscript has metal gall inks, then the manuscript uses iron-based ink
Rule21: When the manuscript uses iron-based ink, then the manuscript shows oxidation patterns
Rule22: Provided that the manuscript shows modern pigments, then the manuscript is not authentic
Rule23: Under the condition that the manuscript has chemical treatment, then the manuscript shows modern bleaching
Rule24: Either the manuscript has chemical treatment or the manuscript shows artificial aging
Rule25: When the manuscript shows artificial aging, then the manuscript shows aging patterns
Rule26: If the manuscript was examined by binding expert, then the manuscript was analyzed by materials scientist
Rule27: Either the manuscript was examined by binding expert or the manuscript was reviewed by conservation specialist
Rule28: Under the condition that the manuscript was reviewed by conservation specialist, then if the manuscript has intact binding, the manuscript does not have replaced pages
Rule29: When the manuscript was analyzed by materials scientist, then provided that the manuscript has intact binding, the manuscript does not have replaced pages
Rule30: If the manuscript passes ink analysis, then the manuscript matches historical style
Rule31: Either the manuscript passes ink analysis or the manuscript passes parchment dating
Rule32: Provided that the manuscript passes parchment dating, then the manuscript is a genuine artifact
Rule33: Should the manuscript not have consistent binding and the manuscript not have original stitching, then the manuscript underwent restoration
Rule34: Provided that the manuscript does not pass UV light test and the manuscript does not pass infrared analysis, then the manuscript shows chemical anomalies
Rule35: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the manuscript was stored in humid environment then the manuscript has fungal growth, then the manuscript requires conservation
Rule36: Should it not be the case that if the manuscript was stored in humid environment then the manuscript has fungal growth, then the manuscript does not require conservation
Rule37: If it is not the case that when the manuscript matches historical style then the manuscript is a genuine artifact, then the manuscript requires further investigation
Rule38: Provided that it is not the case that if the manuscript matches historical style then the manuscript is a genuine artifact, then the manuscript is definitively fake
Rule39: When it is not the case that if the manuscript is definitively fake then the manuscript does not require further investigation, then the manuscript needs museum review

Rule40: Provided that it is not the case that under the condition that the manuscript is definitively fake then the manuscript does not require further investigation, then the manuscript does not need museum review
facts: Fact1: The manuscript was donated by the royal family
Fact2: The manuscript has metal gall inks
Fact3: The manuscript has intact binding
Fact4: The manuscript does not have known provenance
Fact5: The manuscript does not show modern bleaching

question: The manuscript is a genuine artifact
